Tarif Tol Dalkot hingga Jagorawi Naik, Jasa Marga: Sudah Sewajarnya
05 Nov 2019, 07:12 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Foto: Dok. Mizwar Aji

Jakarta - Jasa Marga memastikan akan ada lima ruas tol lagi yang mengalami penyesuaian tarif hingga akhir 2019 mendatang. Kelima ruas tersebut di antaranya tol dalam kota, Jagorawi, Belmera, Surabaya-Gempol, dan Palikanci.Tol dalam kota Jakarta dan Jagorawi sendiri menjadi perhatian lantaran sering macet. Namun penyesuaian tarif sendiri tak terhindarkan mengingat diatur dalam perjanjian pengusahaan jalan tol (PPJT) yang sudah ditandatangani dan diatur dalam undang-undang (UU) jalan.Jasa Marga sebagai badan usaha jalan tol (BUJT) memiliki hak untuk mengajukan penyesuaian setiap dua tahun sekali. Dalam PPJT, badan usaha diberikan konsesi pengusahaan jalan tol dalam jangka waktu tertentu untuk memenuhi pengembalian dana investasi dan keuntungan yang wajar bagi usaha jalan tol."Proses penyesuaian tarif tol sebenarnya proses yang sudah sewajarnya dilaksanakan. Karena memang ada aturannya di undang-undang dan ada di PPJT. Jadi bukan sesuatu yang luar biasa," kata Corporate Communication & Community Development Group Head PT Jasa Marga (Persero) Tbk Dwimawan Heru saat ditemui di Hotel Mercure Ancol, Jakarta, Selasa (4/11/2019).Heru menjelaskan, dengan aturan tersebut maka sudah sewajarnya setiap tahun bakal ada ruas tol yang mengalami penyesuaian (naik/turun tarif). Terlebih dengan pembangunan jalan tol di Indonesia yang semakin masif."Kami harap penyesuaian tarif ini tetap harus dijaga bagi BUJT. Bagaimana mengembalikan investasi dan menjaga iklim investasi jalan tol di Indonesia tetap kondusif," katanya.Penyesuaian tarif diatur dalam Undang-Undang Nomor 38 Tahun 2004 tentang Jalan. Pengguna jalan tol dikenakan kewajiban membayar tarif yang ditetapkan untuk pengembalian investasi, pemeliharaan, dan pengembangan jalan tol.Kepastian tarif tol menjadi salah satu faktor penentu bagi kelayakan usaha dan keberhasilan proyek Kerjasama Pemerintah dengan Swasta (KPS) dalam rangka mempercepat perwujudan jaringan jalan bebas hambatan sebagai bagian dari jaringan jalan nasional.Adapun tarif tol akan dihitung berdasarkan tiga hal, yakni kemampuan bayar pengguna jalan, besar keuntungan biaya operasi kendaraan (BKBOK) dan kelayakan investasi. Hal ini tertera di Pasal 48 ayat (1) Undang-Undang Nomor 38 Tahun 2004 tentang Jalan.Evaluasi dan penyesuaian tarif tol akan dilakukan setiap dua tahun sekali oleh BPJT berdasarkan tarif lama yang disesuaikan dengan pengaruh inflasi sesuai dengan formula, tarif lama dikali 1 ditambah inflasi selama dua tahun terakhir.Formula ini juga sudah diatur dalam Pasal 48 ayat (3) Undang-Undang Nomor 38 Tahun 2004 tentang Jalan dan Pasal 68 ayat (1) Peraturan Pemerintah Nomor 15 Tahun 2005 tentang JalanTol.Adapun pemberlakuan tarif tol awal dan penyesuaian tarif tol akan ditetapkan oleh Menteri PUPR, sesuai Pasal 48 ayat (4) Undang-Undang Nomor 38 Tahun 2004 tentang Jalan dan Pasal 68 ayat (3) Peraturan Pemerintah Nomor 15 Tahun 2005 tentang Jalan Tol.Simak Video "Pengembalian Investasi, Tarif Tol Naik Akhir 2019"[Gambas:Video 20detik](eds/zlf)

Dalkot to Jagorawi Toll Rates Rise, Jasa Marga: It's Naturally
05 Nov 2019, 07:12 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Photo: Doc. Mizwar Aji

Jakarta - Jasa Marga has confirmed that there will be five more toll roads that will have tariff adjustments until the end of 2019. The five toll roads include the inner-city toll road, Jagorawi, Belmera, Surabaya-Gempol, and Palikanci. Toll in the city of Jakarta and Jagorawi itself is a concern because it is often jammed. However, the tariff adjustment itself is unavoidable considering that it is regulated in a toll road concession agreement (PPJT) that has been signed and regulated in a road law (UU). Jasa Marga as a toll road business entity (BUJT) has the right to submit adjustments every two years. In the PPJT, the business entity is granted a concession for a toll road concession within a certain period of time to meet the investment return and a reasonable profit for the toll road business. "The process of adjusting toll rates is actually a process that is properly implemented. Because there are rules in the law and there are at PPJT. So it's not something extraordinary, "said Corporate Communication & Community Development Group Head of PT Jasa Marga (Persero) Tbk Dwimawan Heru when met at the Mercure Ancol Hotel, Jakarta, Tuesday (4/11/2019). Heru explained, with the rule is that naturally every year there will be toll roads that undergo adjustments (increase / decrease in tariffs). Especially with the construction of toll roads in Indonesia which is increasingly massive. "We hope that this tariff adjustment must still be maintained for BUJT. How to return investment and maintain the investment climate for toll roads in Indonesia remain conducive," he said. Tariff adjustment is regulated in Law Number 38 Year 2004 on the Road. Toll road users are subject to the obligation to pay tariffs set for the return of investment, maintenance and development of toll roads. The certainty of toll tariffs is one of the determining factors for business feasibility and the success of the Public Private Partnership (KPS) project in order to accelerate the realization of the expressway network as a part of the national road network. As for toll rates will be calculated based on three things, namely the ability to pay for road users, the profitability of vehicle operating costs (BKBOK) and the feasibility of investment. This is stated in Article 48 paragraph (1) of Law Number 38 of 2004 concerning Roads. Evaluation and adjustment of toll tariffs will be carried out every two years by BPJT based on old rates adjusted for the effect of inflation in accordance with the formula, the old tariff times 1 plus inflation for the past two years. This formula has also been regulated in Article 48 paragraph (3) of Law Number 38 of 2004 concerning Roads and Article 68 paragraph (1) of Government Regulation Number 15 of 2005 concerning Toll Roads. As for the application of initial toll rates and adjustments Toll rates will be determined by the Minister of PUPR, in accordance with Article 48 paragraph (4) of Law Number 38 of 2004 concerning Roads and Article 68 paragraph (3) of Government Regulation Number 15 of 2005 concerning Toll Roads. End of 2019 "[Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (eds / zlf)
